narrative.title: Eighth Army 8Th Army - 1941Q3
narrative.situation: British field_army deployed in North Africa during 1941Q3.
narrative.objectives: Field army for operations in Western Desert. Primary mission: relieve Tobruk garrison and destroy Axis forces in Cyrenaica (Operation Crusader, November 1941).
narrative.axis_objective: Hold current positions and prevent Allied breakthrough.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and neutralize Axis defensive positions.

weather.terrain: Western Desert, Egypt - coastal plain, desert plateau, escarpments near Libya-Egypt border (Halfaya Pass, Sollum, Fort Capuzzo)

special_rules: Combined arms mobile warfare (armoured and infantry corps coordination)
Desert operations expertise (7th Armoured Division veteran)
Air-ground coordination (RAF Western Desert Air Force)
Large-scale logistics over extended supply lines
Commonwealth integration (British, Australian, New Zealand, South African, Indian, Polish formations)

environment.terrain_type: Western Desert, Egypt - coastal plain, desert plateau, escarpments near Libya-Egypt border (Halfaya Pass, Sollum, Fort Capuzzo)

data_source.extraction_method: RAF records aggregate + standard RAF establishments
